summary: Build an app to track expenses and savings with daily user input, updated categories, a royal/adorable visual design with logo, analytics via a super 3D pie chart (no bar chart), statement exports (PDF/CSV), and a dedicated Savings Goals tab.
architectural_notes: Add configurable currency formatting (default INR/₹) used consistently across all amount fields and summaries.
Design UI as mobile-first responsive (touch-friendly controls, readable typography, layouts that adapt to small screens).
Update visual theme direction: remove black/red palette and switch to a vibrant color scheme applied consistently across the UI.
Add a background image themed around “saving money” and ensure readability/contrast of UI elements over it (e.g., overlay/scrim as needed).
Category must be mandatory; show two separate category dropdowns based on selected type (Expense vs Saving) with alphabetically sorted options.
Expense categories: AK Expenses, EB Bill, Internet Bill, Mobile Bill, Online Shopping, Snacks (sorted A–Z). Saving categories: FD, PPF, RD, SIP, Saving Box (sorted A–Z).
Avoid black text; ensure text colors automatically maintain good contrast over the saving-money background image (use overlay/scrim and theme tokens as needed).

Update Expense categories to include: Food, Snacks, Movies, Loans EMI, Transport, Credit Card, AK Expenses, Internet Bill, Mobile Bill, Online Shopping, Others (alphabetically sorted) and use this list for Expense-type dropdowns.
Visual theme direction change: apply a “royal”, adorable design across the app (colors, typography, components) and include a matching app logo.
Add reporting/analytics views with month/year selection for expenses and savings, including pie and bar chart visualizations.
known_issues: App currently shows amounts in USD ($); user requests INR (₹) instead.
Android APK install fails with 'problem parsing the package' / 'not supported' (likely APK download is corrupted/incomplete or a non-APK/HTML file is being downloaded).
Hosted draft app build can expire, breaking access to the APK download page/link.
Text color/word colors in the current UI (as shown in the referenced screenshot) need adjustment for readability/desired styling.
User reports they are unable to add new entries (Add Entry flow not working).

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and per-user data isolation so each signed-in user can only view and manage their own expenses and savings entries.

Build a daily input UI that lets the user add an expense or saving entry with date picker (default today), amount, type toggle, optional category, and note; validate inputs and show clear errors in English.
Create an entries view that displays the user’s entries in a list/table with filters for date range and type (Expense/Saving), and supports editing and deleting entries with confirmation.

Add a dashboard summary showing totals for a selected period (default: current month): total expenses, total savings, and net (savings minus expenses), plus a simple breakdown by category (when categories exist).
Add a coherent, distinctive visual theme and apply it consistently across the app (layout, colors, typography, spacing). Avoid blue and purple as primary colors. Keep user-facing text in English.
Generate and include static visual assets, and render them in the UI (e.g., app header and empty states) from frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update the UI to display all monetary amounts in Indian Rupees (INR) using the ₹ symbol instead of $ across the entire app (entries list/table, dashboard totals, category breakdown, delete confirmation copy, and any other places where amounts are rendered).
Introduce a single reusable currency-formatting helper for INR and refactor amount rendering to use it (so formatting is consistent and easy to change in one place).

Update the UI layout to be mobile-first responsive so the app is comfortable to use on phone screens (approximately 320–430px wide) across the Dashboard and Entries pages, including appropriate spacing, typography scaling, and touch-friendly controls.
Improve mobile navigation and header behavior so users can reliably move between Dashboard and Entries on mobile, including ensuring the mobile nav is always accessible and does not overlap content.

Make the Entries list usable on mobile by adapting the entries table presentation for small screens (e.g., responsive layout that avoids cramped columns), while preserving edit/delete capabilities and existing filters.

Add an Android build packaging workflow that produces an installable .apk for the existing React app, and document the exact steps/commands to generate the APK so it can be installed on an Android phone.
Add a new app page for downloading the latest Android APK, including a clear primary download button/link that downloads a static APK file from the frontend’s public assets (no backend involvement).
Update the existing navigation UI to allow users to reach the new APK download page reliably on mobile and desktop.

Replace the free-text Category input with an optional dropdown selector in both the Add New Entry form and the Edit Entry dialog, using exactly these options: Food, Movies, Loans EMI, Transport, Home Expenses, Credit Card, Others.

Update the app’s visual theme to a red-and-black look across the UI by adjusting the global theme variables and ensuring primary/accent/destructive colors and backgrounds align with a black base and red highlights in both light and dark modes (or by making dark mode the default).

Replace the current red-and-black theme with a vibrant color theme applied consistently across the app (Dashboard, Entries, Download APK, and the sign-in screen), ensuring primary/accent/destructive colors and backgrounds no longer use a black/red palette.
Update the app’s default theme behavior so the initial experience matches the new vibrant theme (i.e., remove reliance on a dark/black default appearance).

Add a full-page background image with a “saving money” visual theme and apply it as the app background in a way that works well with the vibrant color theme (including maintaining text/card readability).

Add a subtle, continuous animated overlay effect on top of the existing full-page saving-money background image (used by the `.app-background` class) so the app feels more lively while keeping all content readable.

Add lightweight UI motion enhancements across the main navigation experience, including smooth page transitions when switching between Dashboard, Entries, and Download APK, and subtle hover/press micro-interactions on key interactive elements.

Replace the single shared Category options list with two separate, alphabetically-sorted dropdown category lists: one for Expense entries and one for Saving entries.

Expense categories (A–Z): AK Expenses, EB Bill, Internet Bill, Mobile Bill, Online Shopping, Snacks.
Saving categories (A–Z): FD, PPF, RD, SIP, Saving Box.

Expose these lists via the existing category constants module so all category dropdowns read from the same source of truth.

Update the Add New Entry form so Category is mandatory and uses two separate dropdowns based on the selected Type:
- When Type is Expense, show only the Expense category dropdown.
- When Type is Saving, show only the Saving category dropdown.

Ensure changing the Type resets/clears any previously selected Category if it is not valid for the newly selected Type.

Update all user-facing labels and validation messages in English (e.g., show “Category *” and prevent submission when no category is selected).

Update the Edit Entry dialog so Category is mandatory and uses two separate dropdowns based on the selected Type:
- When Type is Expense, show only the Expense category dropdown.
- When Type is Saving, show only the Saving category dropdown.

Ensure changing the Type resets/clears any previously selected Category if it is not valid for the newly selected Type, and block saving until a valid category is selected.

Remove black-colored text from the UI by eliminating explicit black text styling (e.g., `text-black`, inline `#000`, or equivalent) and ensure text colors consistently use theme-driven foreground/muted-foreground tokens so they contrast clearly against the existing saving-money background image and overlay.

If needed, adjust theme variables and/or overlay opacity so default text is readable across pages (Dashboard, Entries, Download APK, and sign-in screen).

Update the UI text/icon colors for the words shown in the provided screenshot—specifically the top header title ("Expense Saver"), the main navigation button labels/icons ("Dashboard", "Entries", "Download APK"), and the auth button label ("Login"/"Logout")—so they no longer appear as harsh/flat black and instead use theme-driven colors with strong contrast over the background image/overlay.

Adjust the Dashboard page heading and subheading text colors ("Dashboard" and "Overview of your financial activity") to align with the updated theme-driven text colors and ensure clear readability over the background/overlay.

Update the Expense category dropdown source-of-truth list so the Expense categories are exactly: Food, Snacks, Movies, Loans EMI, Transport, Credit Card, AK Expenses, Internet Bill, Mobile Bill, Online Shopping, Others; and ensure this updated list is used everywhere an Expense category is selected (Add New Entry form and Edit Entry dialog).

Revamp the app’s visual design to a “royal” and adorable look by updating the global theme tokens (colors, surfaces, borders, typography feel) and applying the updated styling consistently across the Dashboard, Entries, Download APK, header/navigation, and sign-in screen, while keeping all user-facing text in English.
Create a new royal/adorable app logo asset and update the app to use it anywhere the current logo is shown (at minimum in the header and sign-in screen).

Update the app’s visual theme (colors, surfaces, typography feel, shadows) and apply it consistently across the entire UI (Dashboard, Entries, Download APK, header/navigation, auth screens), keeping all user-facing text in English.
Add analytics charts (pie chart and bar chart) that support month and year views for Expenses and Savings, based on the signed-in user’s entries.
Add a monthly/yearly statement export feature that lets the user download their Expenses and Savings statement for a selected month or year in PDF and XLS formats.

Add a new top-level “Savings Goals” tab positioned to the right of “Entries” in the main navigation, and implement a Savings Goals page for creating, viewing, updating, and deleting savings goals per signed-in user.
Remove the Analytics bar chart from the app so only the pie-chart-based analytics remain visible (no bar chart UI, no bar chart component rendered).
Replace the current 2D Recharts pie chart with a “super 3D” pie chart visualization for category breakdowns, while keeping the existing month/year period selector and the Expenses/Savings toggle.
Update statement export so users can download statements as PDF and CSV (not TXT), with clear English button labels and correct file extensions.

Implement actual PDF generation for the statement export so the generated file is a valid PDF (not a text file saved with a misleading label/extension), and keep all statement content in English with INR formatting.
Fix the Add Entry flow end-to-end so a signed-in user can successfully create a new entry and see it appear in the Entries list immediately after saving.

Improve frontend error handling for entry creation so failures show a clear English error message that helps the user recover (e.g., show authorization/identity/validation errors instead of only a generic failure toast).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an expenses and savings tracking app that supports daily user input.

Create backend data models and stable storage for daily financial entries, supporting at minimum: date, type (Expense or Saving), amount, optional category, and optional note; and provide CRUD methods for entries.
Display and format amounts in INR (₹) instead of USD ($) across the app (input, lists, dashboard summaries).
Update the app to work well on mobile (mobile-first responsive layout for key screens: daily input, entries list, dashboard).
Provide an Android APK build of the app so it can be installed on a mobile device.
Add an APK download flow so users can directly download the latest Android .apk (e.g., from within the app or via a hosted link/page).

Add repository documentation describing the exact steps to build the APK and publish/replace the ‘latest APK’ file that the app downloads (including where to copy the built APK in the frontend public assets before deploying).
Add a predefined Category dropdown for entries with options: Food, Movies, Loans EMI, Transport, Home Expenses, Credit Card, and Others.
Replace the black-and-red theme with a vibrant color theme applied consistently across the app UI.
Add a “saving money” background image to the app (e.g., as a page/app background) and ensure it works well with the chosen vibrant theme.
Add simple UI animations to complement the new vibrant theme/background (e.g., subtle animated background or transitions).
Make Category mandatory and use two separate Category dropdowns based on entry type (Expense vs Saving), with alphabetically-sorted predefined options for each type.
Update UI text colors to avoid black text and ensure strong contrast/readability over the saving-money background image across the app.

Update the Expense category list to include: Food, Snacks, Movies, Loans EMI, Transport, Credit Card, AK Expenses, Internet Bill, Mobile Bill, Online Shopping, Others (and ensure the expense-type dropdown uses this list).
Revamp the app’s UI to a “royal”, adorable look (colors, overall design) and add/update an app logo to match the new style.
Add a separate “Savings Goals” tab positioned to the right of “Entries”.
Update analytics to remove the bar chart and provide a super 3D pie chart for Expenses and Savings with month/year views.
Update statement export to support PDF and CSV downloads for selected month/year expense & savings statements (replace XLS with CSV).

Update backend access control initialization so authenticated users are reliably granted the required 'user' permissions to use core app functionality (profiles, entries, dashboard, savings goals) without needing an admin secret token.
